title: Nigeria and Covid-19: Fact-checking claims about vaccines and lack of research
subtitle: A top pharmacist says the continent’s largest economy has been reduced to a bystander in the race to counter the coronavirus pandemic. Are some of his claims correct?
author: africacheck.org
vclaim:
• None Prominent pharmacist Sam Ohuabunwa said Nigeria’s government could have done more to control the Covid-19 outbreak.
• None He claimed the country was able to produce vaccines in the 1970s and 1980s, but today produced none. Both claims are correct.
• None Ohuabunwa’s claim that Nigeria has 69 research institutes is unproven. A fourth claim, that the federal government is not funding any Covid-19 research, is incorrect.
